alert.note: Alert for Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:04PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Crenshaw County through 645 PM CDT... At 604 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Lapine, or 10 miles southwest of Meadville, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Petrey and Highland Home. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
